Therefore, the possibility of hitting the zero lower bound in the future aects potentially the equilibrium outcome in times of unconstrained monetary policy. We use time iteration (Coleman 1990 and Judd 1998) with piecewise linear interpolation of policy functions as in Richter et al. (2014).13 Expectations are calculated using numerical integration based on Gauss-Hermite quadrature.
